data_structure.description: Japanese profanity database with cultural context and romanization

entry_format.severity: Severity level (1-4) adjusted for Japanese cultural context
entry_format.variations: Character variations, kanji alternatives, romanized forms
entry_format.target_type: Whether it targets individuals, groups, or is general
entry_format.formality_level: Keigo violation level or casualness indicator

cultural_context.hierarchy_importance: Japanese society heavily emphasizes respect and hierarchy
cultural_context.directness_taboo: Direct confrontation and explicit language is more offensive than in Western cultures
cultural_context.keigo_system: Honorific language system where violations can be considered rude
cultural_context.internet_culture: 2ch/5ch culture has developed unique slang and expressions

words.context_notes: Common mild insult meaning 'stupid' or 'idiot', widely used in anime/manga. Hiragana: ばか, Katakana: バカ, Kanji: 馬鹿, Romaji: baka
Stronger version meaning 'stupid bastard'. Hiragana: ばかやろう, Katakana: バカヤロウ, Kanji: 馬鹿野郎, Romaji: bakayarou
Intensified form meaning 'big idiot'. Hiragana: おおばか, Kanji: 大馬鹿, Romaji: oobaka
Variant meaning 'stupid fool'. Hiragana: ばかたれ, Kanji: 馬鹿たれ, Romaji: bakatare
Meaning 'shit' or 'damn', commonly used as intensifier. Hiragana: くそ, Katakana: クソ, Kanji: 糞, Romaji: kuso
Strong insult meaning 'eat shit'. Hiragana: くそくらえ, Katakana: クソ食らえ, Romaji: kuso kurae
Compound profanity meaning 'piece of shit'. Hiragana: くそやろう, Katakana/Mixed: クソ野郎, Romaji: kusoyarou
Buddhist term meaning 'beast', used as curse word. Hiragana: ちくしょう, Katakana: チクショウ, Kanji: 畜生, Romaji: chikushou
Kansai dialect equivalent of 'baka', slightly stronger in Tokyo. Hiragana: あほう, Katakana: アホ, Kanji: 阿呆, Romaji: aho
Kansai variant meaning 'stupid fool'. Hiragana: あほたれ, Kanji: 阿呆たれ, Romaji: ahotare
Vulgar command meaning 'drop dead' or 'croak'. Hiragana: くたばれ, Katakana: クタバレ, Romaji: kutabare
Aggressive phrase meaning 'bullshit' or 'don't mess with me'. Hiragana: ざけんな, Romaji: zakenna
Command meaning 'don't mess with me' or 'stop joking around'. Hiragana: ふざけるな/ふざけんな, Romaji: fuzakeru na
Means 'fool' or 'clueless'. Hiragana: まぬけ, Katakana: マヌケ, Kanji: 間抜け, Romaji: manuke
Kansai term meaning 'fool' or 'stupid', used in comedy. Hiragana: ぼけ, Katakana: ボケ, Romaji: boke
Means 'blockhead' or 'fool'. Hiragana: とんま, Katakana: トンマ, Romaji: tonma
Playful insult meaning 'dummy' or 'birdbrain'. Hiragana: おたんこなす, Katakana: オタンコナス, Romaji: otankonasu
Means 'incompetent' or 'useless'. Hiragana: のうなし, Kanji: 能無し, Romaji: nounashi
Means 'brainless' or 'not enough brains'. Hiragana: のうたりん, Kanji: 脳足りん, Romaji: nou tarin
Means 'slowpoke' or 'dunce'. Hiragana: のろま, Katakana: ノロマ, Romaji: noroma
Means 'low intelligence', ableist connotation. Hiragana: ていのう, Kanji: 低脳, Romaji: teinou
Medical term for mental disability used as severe insult. Hiragana: はくち, Katakana: ハクチ, Kanji: 白痴, Romaji: hakuchi
Formal term meaning 'foolish person'. Hiragana: おろかもの, Kanji: 愚か者, Romaji: orokamono
Derogatory term for ugly woman, quite hurtful. Hiragana: ぶす, Katakana: ブス, Romaji: busu
Means 'ugly' or 'unattractive'. Hiragana: ぶさいく, Katakana: ブサイク, Kanji: 不細工, Romaji: busaiku
Derogatory term for fat person, considered bullying. Hiragana: でぶ, Katakana: デブ, Romaji: debu
Means 'pig', used to insult overweight people. Hiragana: ぶた, Katakana: ブタ, Kanji: 豚, Romaji: buta
Means 'gorilla', used for big or violent people. Hiragana: ごりら, Katakana: ゴリラ, Romaji: gorira
Means 'monkey', derogatory term. Hiragana: さる, Katakana: サル, Kanji: 猿, Romaji: saru
Means 'monster' or 'freak'. Hiragana: ばけもの, Katakana: バケモノ, Kanji: 化け物, Romaji: bakemono
Means 'baldy' or 'bald person'. Hiragana: はげ, Katakana: ハゲ, Romaji: hage
Means 'shorty' or 'small person'. Hiragana: ちび, Katakana: チビ, Romaji: chibi
Means 'ugly' or 'hideous'. Hiragana: みにくい, Kanji: 醜い, Romaji: minikui
Slang for 'gross' or 'disgusting', from 'kimochi warui'. Hiragana: きもい, Katakana: キモイ, Full form: 気持ち悪い, Romaji: kimoi
Means 'smelly' or 'stinky'. Hiragana: くさい, Katakana: クサイ, Romaji: kusai
Means 'dirty' or 'filthy'. Hiragana: きたない, Kanji: 汚い, Romaji: kitanai
Extremely rude pronoun 'you', was once respectful but became hostile. Hiragana: きさま, Katakana: キサマ, Kanji: 貴様, Romaji: kisama
Hostile pronoun meaning 'you bastard'. Hiragana: てめえ, Katakana: テメエ, Kanji: 手前, Romaji: temee
Rude/casual pronoun 'you'. Hiragana: おまえ, Katakana: オマエ, Kanji: お前, Romaji: omae
Derogatory third person 'that guy'. Hiragana: やつ, Katakana: ヤツ, Kanji: 奴, Romaji: yatsu
Rude demonstrative 'this guy'. Hiragana: こいつ, Katakana: コイツ, Romaji: koitsu
Rude demonstrative 'that guy'. Hiragana: あいつ, Katakana: アイツ, Romaji: aitsu
Rude demonstrative 'that person'. Hiragana: そいつ, Katakana: ソイツ, Romaji: soitsu
Means 'bastard' or 'jerk'. Hiragana: やろう, Katakana: ヤロウ, Kanji: 野郎, Romaji: yarou
Compound profanity meaning 'lowlife asshole'. Hiragana: げすやろう, Kanji: 下衆野郎, Romaji: gesuyarou
Extremely offensive command meaning 'die', considered very serious threat. Hiragana: しね, Katakana: シネ, Kanji: 死ね, Internet variant: 氏ね, Romaji: shine
Extremely offensive command meaning 'drop dead'. Hiragana: しんじまえ, Kanji: 死んじまえ, Romaji: shinjimae
Verb meaning 'to kill', extremely serious when directed at person. Hiragana: ころす, Katakana: コロス, Kanji: 殺す, Romaji: korosu
Explicit death threat meaning 'I'll kill you'. Hiragana: ころすぞ, Kanji: 殺すぞ, Romaji: korosu zo
Harsh command meaning 'shut up'. Hiragana: だまれ, Katakana: ダマレ, Kanji: 黙れ, Romaji: damare
Means 'shut up' or 'noisy', rude command. Hiragana: うるさい, Katakana: ウルサイ, Kanji: 五月蝿い, Romaji: urusai
Harsh command meaning 'get out of my way'. Hiragana: どけ, Katakana: ドケ, Romaji: doke
Harsh command meaning 'get lost' or 'piss off'. Hiragana: うせろ, Kanji: 失せろ, Romaji: usero
Harsh command meaning 'disappear' or 'get lost'. Hiragana: きえろ, Kanji: 消えろ, Romaji: kiero
Means 'pervert', also known in Western culture through anime. Hiragana: へんたい, Katakana: ヘンタイ, Kanji: 変態, Romaji: hentai
Means 'lecher' or 'pervert'. Hiragana: すけべ, Katakana: スケベ, Kanji: 助平, Romaji: sukebe
Means 'perverted' or 'sexual', from English 'erotic'. Hiragana: えろ, Katakana: エロ, Romaji: ero
Means 'lewd', 'naughty', or 'sex', from letter 'H'. Hiragana: えっち, Katakana: エッチ, Romaji: ecchi
Extremely derogatory term for promiscuous woman, means 'slut'. Hiragana: やりまん, Katakana: ヤリマン, Romaji: yariman
Derogatory term for promiscuous man, means 'man-whore'. Hiragana: やりちん, Katakana: ヤリチン, Romaji: yarichin
Derogatory term for prostitute, highly offensive to women. Hiragana: いんばい, Katakana: インバイ, Kanji: 淫売, Romaji: inbai
Term for prostitute, offensive when used as insult. Hiragana: ばいしゅんふ, Kanji: 売春婦, Romaji: baishunfu
Term for prostitute, offensive when used as insult. Hiragana: しょうふ, Kanji: 娼婦, Romaji: shoufu
Archaic term for prostitute. Hiragana: じょろう, Kanji: 女郎, Romaji: jorou
Derogatory term meaning 'easy woman' or 'promiscuous'. Hiragana: しりがる, Kanji: 尻軽, Romaji: shirigaru
Means 'player' or 'womanizer'. Hiragana: あそびにん, Kanji: 遊び人, Romaji: asobinin
Highly offensive term meaning 'bitch' or 'slut'. Hiragana: あばずれ, Katakana: アバズレ, Romaji: abazure
Vulgar term for penis/dick, childish/crude. Hiragana: ちんこ, Katakana: チンコ, Romaji: chinko
Vulgar term for penis/dick. Hiragana: ちんぽ/ちんぽこ, Katakana: チンポ, Romaji: chinpo
Vulgar Buddhist term for penis. Hiragana: まら, Katakana: マラ, Romaji: mara
Vulgar term for testicles/balls. Hiragana: きんたま, Katakana: キンタマ, Kanji: 金玉, Shortened: タマ, Romaji: kintama
Vulgar term for vagina/cunt, highly offensive. Hiragana: まんこ, Katakana: マンコ, Romaji: manko
Vulgar term for vagina/cunt with honorific prefix, highly offensive. Hiragana: おまんこ, Katakana: オマンコ, Romaji: omanko
Casual/vulgar term for breasts/boobs. Hiragana: おっぱい, Katakana: オッパイ, Romaji: oppai
Term for breasts/tits, can be vulgar in context. Hiragana: ちち, Kanji: 乳, Romaji: chichi
Childish term for penis with honorific prefix. Hiragana: おちんちん, Katakana: オチンチン, Romaji: ochinchin
Casual/vulgar term for ass/butt. Hiragana: けつ, Katakana: ケツ, Kanji: 尻, Romaji: ketsu
Vulgar term for asshole. Hiragana: けつのあな, Katakana/Mixed: ケツの穴, Romaji: ketsu no ana
Clinical term for anus. Hiragana: こうもん, Kanji: 肛門, Romaji: koumon
Childish/casual term for shit/poop. Hiragana: うんこ, Katakana: ウンコ, Romaji: unko
Clinical term for feces. Hiragana: だいべん, Kanji: 大便, Romaji: daiben
Casual term for urine/piss. Hiragana: しょうべん/しょんべん, Katakana: ションベン, Kanji: 小便, Romaji: shouben/shonben
Childish term for pee/urine. Hiragana: おしっこ, Katakana: オシッコ, Romaji: oshikko
Internet slang meaning 'annoying' or 'irritating'. Hiragana: うざい, Katakana: ウザイ, Romaji: uzai
Intensified form meaning 'super annoying'. Hiragana: うざったい, Katakana/Mixed: ウザったい, Romaji: uzattai
Means 'irritating' or 'pisses me off'. Hiragana: むかつく, Katakana/Mixed: ムカつく, Romaji: mukatsuku
Means 'makes me angry'. Hiragana: はらたつ, Kanji: 腹立つ, Romaji: hara tatsu
Means 'liar'. Hiragana: うそつき, Katakana: ウソツキ, Kanji: 嘘つき, Romaji: usotsuki
Means 'coward' or 'cowardly'. Hiragana: ひきょう, Kanji: 卑怯, Romaji: hikyou
Means 'weakling' or 'coward'. Hiragana: よわむし, Katakana: ヨワムシ, Kanji: 弱虫, Romaji: yowamushi
Means 'coward', literally 'one who loses their hips/backbone'. Hiragana: こしぬけ, Kanji: 腰抜け, Romaji: koshinuke
Means 'coward'. Hiragana: おくびょうもの, Kanji: 臆病者, Romaji: okubyoumono
Means 'stingy' or 'cheap'. Hiragana: けち, Katakana: ケチ, Romaji: kechi
Means 'unfair' or 'sneaky'. Hiragana: ずるい, Katakana/Mixed: ズルい, Romaji: zurui
Means 'lame' or 'uncool'. Katakana: ダサい, Hiragana: ださい, Romaji: dasai
Means 'trash' or 'scum'. Hiragana: くず, Katakana: クズ, Kanji: 屑, Romaji: kuzu
Means 'scum' or 'worthless'. Hiragana: かす, Katakana: カス, Kanji: 滓, Romaji: kasu
Means 'garbage' or 'trash'. Hiragana: ごみ, Katakana: ゴミ, Romaji: gomi
Means 'dust' or 'trash', literary insult. Hiragana: ちり, Kanji: 塵, Romaji: chiri
Derogatory term for brat/kid. Hiragana: がき, Katakana: ガキ, Kanji: 餓鬼, Romaji: gaki
Compound profanity meaning 'little brat' or 'shitty kid'. Hiragana: くそがき, Katakana/Mixed: 糞ガキ, Romaji: kusogaki
Rude term for old man. Hiragana: じじい, Katakana: ジジイ, Kanji: 爺, Romaji: jijii
Compound profanity meaning 'old fart'. Hiragana: くそじじい, Katakana: クソジジイ, Romaji: kusojijii
Rude term for old woman/hag. Hiragana: ばばあ, Katakana: ババア, Kanji: 婆, Romaji: babaa
Compound profanity meaning 'old hag'. Hiragana: くそばばあ, Katakana: クソババア, Romaji: kusobabaa
Extremely offensive ethnic slur against Koreans, banned from broadcast. Hiragana: ちょん, Katakana: チョン, Romaji: chon
When used derogatorily, becomes ethnic slur against Koreans. Hiragana: ちょうせんじん, Katakana: チョウセンジン, Kanji: 朝鮮人, Romaji: chousenjin
Derogatory historical term for China, now considered offensive. Hiragana: しな, Katakana: シナ, Kanji: 支那, Romaji: shina
Extremely offensive slur meaning 'hairy barbarian', used for Westerners. Hiragana: けとう, Kanji: 毛唐, Romaji: ketou
Term for foreigner, can be neutral or derogatory depending on context. Hiragana: がいじん, Katakana: ガイジン, Kanji: 外人, Romaji: gaijin
Term for effeminate man or drag queen, can be derogatory depending on context. Hiragana: おかま, Katakana: オカマ, Romaji: okama
Shortened form of homosexual, often used derogatorily. Hiragana: ほも, Katakana: ホモ, Romaji: homo
Shortened form of lesbian, often used derogatorily. Hiragana: れず, Katakana: レズ, Romaji: rezu
Term for effeminate man, can be neutral or derogatory. Hiragana: おねえ, Katakana: オネエ, Romaji: onee
Extremely offensive term for mentally ill person, banned from media. Hiragana: きちがい, Katakana: キチガイ, Kanji: 基地外/気違い, Romaji: kichigai
Internet slang abbreviation for mental disability, extremely offensive, banned from broadcast. Hiragana: いけしょう, Katakana: イケショウ, Kanji: 池沼, Romaji: ikeshou
Ableist term meaning 'mentally retarded'. Hiragana: ちえおくれ, Kanji: 知恵遅れ, Romaji: chieokure
Term for disabled person, neutral in proper context but offensive when used as insult. Hiragana: しょうがいしゃ, Kanji: 障害者, Romaji: shougaisha
Extremely offensive slur for cripple/disabled person, banned from broadcast. Hiragana: かたわ, Katakana: カタワ, Kanji: 片輪, Romaji: katawa
Extremely offensive slur meaning 'lame' or 'cripple', banned from broadcast. Hiragana: びっこ, Katakana: ビッコ, Kanji: 跛, Romaji: bikko
Extremely offensive slur for blind person, banned from broadcast. Hiragana: めくら, Katakana: メクラ, Kanji: 盲, Romaji: mekura
Extremely offensive slur for deaf person, banned from broadcast. Hiragana: つんぼ, Katakana: ツンボ, Romaji: tsunbo
Internet slang for delinquent or troublemaker, from TV show name. Katakana: ドキュン, Romaji: DQN/dokyun
Internet slang meaning 'middle schooler', implies immaturity. Hiragana: ちゅうぼう, Katakana: チュウボウ, Kanji: 厨房, Shortened: 厨, Romaji: chuubou
Refers to generation with 'relaxed education', implies laziness. Hiragana: ゆとり, Katakana: ユトリ, Romaji: yutori
Internet slang meaning 'information-poor' or 'uninformed'. Hiragana: じょうじゃく, Kanji: 情弱, Romaji: joujaku
Internet slang meaning 'normie', can be derogatory in some contexts. Hiragana: りあじゅう, Katakana/Kanji: リア充, Romaji: riajuu
Internet slang for introverted loser. Hiragana: いんきゃ, Kanji: 陰キャ, Romaji: inkya
Internet slang for extroverted person, can be negative in some contexts. Hiragana: ようきゃ, Kanji: 陽キャ, Romaji: youkya
Internet slang meaning 'fake normie'. Hiragana: きょろじゅう, Katakana/Kanji: キョロ充, Romaji: kyorojuu
Modern slang verb meaning 'to diss' or 'insult', from English. Hiragana: でぃする, Katakana: ディスる, Romaji: disuru
Term for male virgin, used mockingly in internet culture. Hiragana: どうてい, Katakana: ドウテイ, Kanji: 童貞, Romaji: doutei
Term for female virgin, less commonly used as insult than doutei. Hiragana: しょじょ, Katakana: ショジョ, Kanji: 処女, Romaji: shojo
Originally meant 'dangerous' but now used as 'awesome/terrible' depending on context. Hiragana: やばい, Katakana: ヤバイ, Romaji: yabai
Means 'troublesome' or 'bothersome', mildly rude. Hiragana: めんどくさい, Katakana: メンドクサイ, Romaji: mendokusai

internet_culture_terms.context_notes: ASCII art expressing frustration or depression
